description: Describes a legal purchase order. It contains the complete details of the legal contract created between the buyer and the seller.

add_ons.description: The add-ons purchased / availed in this order

billing.description: The billing details of this order

cancellation.description: The cancellation details of this order

created_at.description: The date-time of creation of this order

fulfillments.description: The fulfillments involved in completing this order

id.description: Human-readable ID of the order. This is generated at the BPP layer. The BPP can either generate order id within its system or forward the order ID created at the provider level.

items.description: The items purchased / availed in this order

offers.description: The offers applied in this order

payments.description: The terms of settlement for this order

provider.description: Details of the provider whose catalog items have been selected.

quote.description: The mutually agreed upon quotation for this order.

ref_order_ids.description: A list of order IDs to link this order to previous orders.

status.description: Status of the order. Allowed values can be defined by the network policy

type.description: This is used to indicate the type of order being created to BPPs. Sometimes orders can be linked to previous orders, like a replacement order in a retail domain. A follow-up consultation in healthcare domain. A single order part of a subscription order. The list of order types can be standardized at the network level.

updated_at.description: The date-time of updated of this order

xinput.description: Additional input required from the customer to confirm this order
